lustre/tests/rwv.c

00035 
00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <sys/types.h>
00038 #include <sys/stat.h>
00039 #include <sys/uio.h>
00040 #include <sys/mman.h>
00041 #include <fcntl.h>
00042 #include <errno.h>
00043 #include <stdlib.h>
00044 #include <unistd.h>
00045 
00046 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>
00047 
00048 #define ACT_NONE        0
00049 #define ACT_READ        1
00050 #define ACT_WRITE       2
00051 #define ACT_SEEK        4
00052 #define ACT_READHOLE    8
00053 #define ACT_VERIFY      16
00054 
00055 void usage()
00056 {
00057         printf("usage: rwv -f filename <-r|-w> [-a] [-z] [-d] [-v]"
00058                 "[-s offset] -n iovcnt SIZE1 SIZE2 SIZE3...\n");
00059         printf("-a  append IO (O_APPEND)\n");
00060         printf("-r  file read (O_RDONLY)\n");
00061         printf("-w  file write (O_WRONLY)\n");
00062         printf("-s  set the start pos of the read/write test\n");
00063         printf("-z  test for read hitting hole\n");
00064         printf("-d  create flags (O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE)\n");
00065         printf("-v  verify the data content of read\n");
00066 }
00067 
00068 int data_verify(struct iovec *iov, int iovcnt, char c)
00069 {
00070         int i;
00071 
00072         for (i = 0; i < iovcnt; i++) {
00073                 size_t count = iov[i].iov_len;
00074                 char *s = iov[i].iov_base;
00075 
00076                 for (; count > 0; ++s, count--) {
00077                         if (*s != c) {
00078                                 printf("Data mismatch %x: %x\n", *s, c);
00079                                 return 1;
00080                         }
00081                 }
00082         }
00083         return 0;
00084 }
00085 
00086 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00087 {
00088         int c;
00089         int fd;
00090         int rc = 0;
00091         int flags = 0;
00092         int iovcnt = 0;
00093         int act = ACT_NONE;
00094         char pad = 0xba;
00095         char *end;
00096         char *fname = "FILE";
00097         unsigned long len = 0;
00098         struct iovec *iov;
00099         off64_t offset = 0;
00100 
00101         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "f:n:s:rwahvdz")) != -1) {
00102                 switch (c) {
00103                 case 'f':
00104                         fname = optarg;
00105                         break;
00106                 case 'n':
00107                         iovcnt = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00108                         if (*end) {
00109                                 printf("Bad iov count: %s\n", optarg);
00110                                 return 1;
00111                         }
00112                         if (iovcnt > UIO_MAXIOV || iovcnt <= 0) {
00113                                 printf("Wrong iov count\n");
00114                                 return 1;
00115                         }
00116                         break;
00117                 case 's':
00118                         act |= ACT_SEEK;
00119                         offset = strtoull(optarg, &end, 0);
00120                         if (*end) {
00121                                 printf("Bad seek offset: %s\n", optarg);
00122                                 return 1;
00123                         }
00124                         break;
00125                 case 'w':
00126                         act |= ACT_WRITE;
00127                         break;
00128                 case 'r':
00129                         act |= ACT_READ;
00130                         break;
00131                 case 'a':
00132                         flags |= O_APPEND;
00133                         break;
00134                 case 'd':
00135                         flags |= O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE;
00136                         break;
00137                 case 'z':
00138                         pad = 0;
00139                         act |= ACT_READHOLE;
00140                         break;
00141                 case 'v':
00142                         act |= ACT_VERIFY;
00143                         break;
00144                 case 'h':
00145                         usage();
00146                         break;
00147                 }
00148         }
00149 
00150         if (act == ACT_NONE) {
00151                 usage();
00152                 return 1;
00153         }
00154 
00155         if ((act & ACT_READ) &&  (act & ACT_WRITE)) {
00156                 printf("Read and write test should be exclusive\n");
00157                 return 1;
00158         }
00159 
00160         if (argc - optind < iovcnt) {
00161                 printf("Not enough parameters for iov size\n");
00162                 return 1;
00163         }
00164 
00165         iov = (struct iovec *)malloc(iovcnt * sizeof(struct iovec));
00166         if (iov == NULL) {
00167                 printf("No memory %s\n", strerror(errno));
00168                 return 1;
00169         }
00170 
00171         for (c = 0; c < iovcnt; c++) {
00172                 struct iovec *iv = &iov[c];
00173 
00174                 iv->iov_len = strtoul(argv[optind++], &end, 0);
00175                 if (*end) {
00176                         printf("Error iov size\n");
00177                         rc = 1;
00178                         goto out;
00179                 }
00180                 iv->iov_base = mmap(NULL, iv->iov_len, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
00181                                     MAP_PRIVATE | MAP_ANON, 0, 0);
00182                 if (iv->iov_base == MAP_FAILED) {
00183                         printf("No memory %s\n", strerror(errno));
00184                         rc = 1;
00185                         goto out;
00186                 }
00187                 if (act & ACT_WRITE)
00188                         memset(iv->iov_base, pad, iv->iov_len);
00189                 len += iv->iov_len;
00190         }
00191 
00192         fd = open(fname, O_LARGEFILE | O_RDWR | O_CREAT | flags, 0644);
00193         if (fd == -1) {
00194                 printf("Cannot open %s:%s\n", fname, strerror(errno));
00195                 return 1;
00196         }
00197 
00198         if ((act & ACT_SEEK) && (lseek64(fd, offset, SEEK_SET) < 0)) {
00199                 printf("Cannot seek %s\n", strerror(errno));
00200                 rc = 1;
00201                 goto out;
00202         }
00203 
00204         if (act & ACT_WRITE) {
00205                 rc = writev(fd, iov, iovcnt);
00206                 if (rc != len) {
00207                         printf("Write error: %s (rc = %d, len = %ld)\n",
00208                                 strerror(errno), rc, len);
00209                         rc = 1;
00210                         goto out;
00211                 }
00212         } else if (act & ACT_READ) {
00213                 rc = readv(fd, iov, iovcnt);
00214                 if (rc != len) {
00215                         printf("Read error: %s rc = %d\n", strerror(errno), rc);
00216                         rc = 1;
00217                         goto out;
00218                 }
00219 
00220                 /* It should return zeroed buf if the read hits hole.*/
00221                 if (((act & ACT_READHOLE) || (act & ACT_VERIFY)) &&
00222                     data_verify(iov, iovcnt, pad)) {
00223                         rc = 1;
00224                         goto out;
00225                 }
00226         }
00227 
00228         rc = 0;
00229 out:
00230         if (iov)
00231                 free(iov);
00232         return rc;
00233 }
